XenSCE: exploration of a class for Xenium demonstration data

Vincent J. Carey, stvjc at channing.harvard.edu

August 08, 2024

Source: vignettes/XenSCE.Rmd
XenSCE.Rmd

Introduction

This package is based on a dataset distributed by TENx genomics as Human FFPE Brain Cancer Data. We have taken several components of the distribution and placed them in an NSF Open Storage Network bucket.

A basic concern is to acquire the data for local computation. The cache_assets function in this package will download and cache about 4GB of compressed sparse matrix and parquet data files; it returns the paths to these resources. The build_demo function creates an instance of XenSCE. This class extends SingleCellExperiment to include references to parquet files that manage voluminous geometry data.

Data retrieval and caching

Use cache_assets() to retrieve data from the web. Use x = build_demo() to produce x, an instance of XenSCE. Use cache_demo(x) to save this in cache, and y = retrieve_demo() to restore the cached image in y. Once this cycle has been completed, retrieve_demo can be used in any session to obtain the instance.

A quick look 

library(XenSCE)
myxen = retrieve_demo() # steps noted above were done
myxen
## class: XenSCE 
## dim: 541 816769 
## metadata(0):
## assays(1): counts
## rownames(541): ENSG00000175899 ENSG00000130234 ...
##   NegControlCodeword_0539 NegControlCodeword_0540
## rowData names(3): ensid symbol type
## colnames: NULL
## colData names(11): cell_id x_centroid ... cell_area nucleus_area
## reducedDimNames(0):
## mainExpName: NULL
## altExpNames(0):
## Parquet elements:
##                  nrow ncol
## transcripts 178716169   11
## cellbounds   20412973    4
## nucbounds    20318135    4

Let’s sample the cell centroid coordinates and plot.

set.seed(1234)
sinds = sort(sample(seq_len(ncol(myxen)), 5000))
plot(myxen$x_centroid[sinds], -myxen$y_centroid[sinds],
  xlab="x", ylab="y", main="Sample of 5000 centroids", pty="s")

Compare the basic layout to the ‘summary’ visualization shipped with the data.

from site
